title: Trump Booed at World Series Game in DC, Crowd Chants ‘Lock Him Up’
text:
President Trump was greeted by chants of “Lock Him Up” and resounding boos from a stadium filled with baseball fans at the World Series game in Washington DC on Sunday evening.

The monitor at Nationals Park showed the president going from a broad smile to a serious expression as it became clear that the crowd was booing roundly when he was announced.

Trump 2 at World Series More

Later the crowd chanted “Lock Him Up,” a favorite of Trump rallies, usually referring to Democratic opponents. The chant follows days of revelations in the Democratic-led impeachment investigation in the House of Representatives.

The Houston Astros beat the Washington Nationals 7 runs to 1 at the best-of-seven series continues at Nationals Park. The series is tied entering Game 5 after the Astros rallied for two consecutive wins to even the Fall Classic. The Astros are up, 5-1, as they try to take a 3-2 series lead back to Houston.

In addition to the chants from the crowd, there were signs unfurled that read “Impeach Trump.”





Look how Trump’s face changes when he realizes an entire stadium is booing him pic.twitter.com/E46rzbzmbl

— Arlen Parsa (@arlenparsa) October 28, 2019







Baseball fans aren't having it. Another impeachment sign greets Trump at #WorldSeries #NeedToImpeach pic.twitter.com/WyHkCoCjfI

— CPD Action (@CPDAction) October 28, 2019







lmao the change from cheering to booing furiously to cheering again https://t.co/Cp7vZ8qxxX

— Ryan Pequin (@ryanpequin) October 28, 2019
